an4.73:1.1: “Mendicants, a bad person can be known by four qualities.
an4.73:1.3: To start with, a bad person speaks ill of another even when not asked, let alone when asked.
an4.73:1.4: But when led on by questions they speak ill of another in full detail, not leaving anything out.
an4.73:1.5: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.
an4.73:2.1: Furthermore, a bad person doesn’t speak well of another even when asked, let alone when not asked.
an4.73:2.2: But when led on by questions they speak well of another without giving the full details, leaving many things out.
an4.73:2.3: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.
an4.73:3.1: Furthermore, a bad person doesn’t speak ill of themselves even when asked, let alone when not asked.
an4.73:3.2: But when led on by questions they speak ill of themselves without giving the full details, leaving many things out.
an4.73:3.3: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.
an4.73:4.1: Furthermore, a bad person speaks well of themselves even when not asked, let alone when asked.
an4.73:4.2: But when led on by questions they speak well of themselves in full detail, not leaving anything out.
an4.73:4.3: That’s how to know that this is a bad person.
an4.73:4.4: A bad person can be known by these four qualities.
an4.73:5.1: A good person can be known by four qualities.
an4.73:5.3: To start with, a good person doesn’t speak ill of another even when asked, let alone when not asked.
an4.73:5.4: But when led on by questions they speak ill of another without giving the full details, leaving many things out.
an4.73:5.5: That’s how to know that this is a good person.
an4.73:6.1: Furthermore, a good person speaks well of another even when not asked, let alone when asked.
an4.73:6.2: But when led on by questions they speak well of another in full detail, not leaving anything out.
an4.73:6.3: That’s how to know that this is a good person.
an4.73:7.1: Furthermore, a good person speaks ill of themselves even when not asked, let alone when asked.
an4.73:7.2: But when led on by questions they speak ill of themselves in full detail, not leaving anything out.
an4.73:7.3: That’s how to know that this is a good person.
an4.73:8.1: Furthermore, a good person doesn’t speak well of themselves even when asked, let alone when not asked.
an4.73:8.2: But when led on by questions they speak well of themselves without giving the full details, leaving many things out.
an4.73:8.3: That’s how to know that this is a good person.
an4.73:8.4: A good person can be known by these four qualities.
an4.73:9.1: It’s like a bride on the day or night she’s first brought to her husband’s home. Right away she sets up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for her mother and father in law, her husband, and even the bondservants, workers, and staff.
an4.73:9.2: But after some time, because of living together and familiarity, she’ll even say to her mother and father in law, or to her husband:
an4.73:9.4: In the same way, on the day or night a mendicant first goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, right away they set up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, and even the monastery workers and novices.
an4.73:9.5: But after some time, because of living together and familiarity, they’ll even say to their teacher or mentor:
an4.73:9.7: So you should train like this:
an4.73:9.8: ‘We will live with hearts like that of a newly wedded bride.’
